column4: The vatican is incredibly upset regarding our anti-religious policies. The pope has issued a statement decrying our rule, and our religious citizens are becoming further disgruntled.

The next giant leap for mankind has been taken. Billions watched as astronauts from your country were the first-ever humans to land on the Martian surface. This has surely been an event that will go down in the history books!

In an event that would have seemed ridiculous to imagine as little as ten years ago, a private corporation has landed their own astronauts on the moon! This accomplishment marks the beginning of a new age for capitalism, and the start of a true space-based economy.

In a devastating turn of events, the manned mission on its way to Mars has met with a terrible fate. What started as a minor issue soon crippled the technology necessary to survive, leaving no hope to escape for the mission crew on-board.

It seems that our efforts regarding the search for alien life have proved fruitful. Scientists have now announced that they have discovered traces of microbial life outside of our solar system. Many see this as a further sign that we aren't alone.
A summit held recently between some of the most powerful leaders in the world has gone better than many anticipated. Tensions are down across the globe, thanks partly to your input and negotiations.

A recent news report exposed, what they call the dirty truth, about our energy policy. Turns out that a lot of the electricity we import from our neighbors comes from carbon intensive sources such as coal fired power plants.

column3: International praise for low carbon electricity
column4: World leaders and international media outlets have praised our hard work with phasing out fossil fuels from our energy mix. We're being seen as a role model by many nations in the fight against climate change.

column3: Minor accident at nuclear power station
column4: An accident has occured at one of our larger nuclear power stations. While no one was injured and no radiation leaked out, the plant will be running at reduced capacity until vital components are repaired.

column3: Major incident at nuclear power station
column4: A major incident, in the form of an explosion, has occured in a large nuclear power station. Several workers were injured and the immediate area around the plant was contaminated with highly radioactive materials. The chief nuclear engineer assures us this will never happen again.
Due to really bad weather, some major power transmission lines were damaged and this has caused blackouts in some areas of the country. Engineers are working on fixing it.

Weather forecasts show that the weather of the coming months will be more intensive then usual. This will drive up the demand for electricity as people use their home appliances to maintain comfort in their homes.
